DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study compare two commonly-used medication protocol ( low-dose clomiphene citrate high dose gonadotropin protocol ) treatment patient diminish ovarian reserve ( decreased number egg remain ovary ) undergo IVF . This research do know two medication protocol equally likely help woman become pregnant .
DOC.brief_title: RCT Low-dose Clomiphene vs. High Dose Gonadotropin Protocol IVF Poor Responders
DOC.detailed_description: The objective protocol prospectively evaluate whether clomid-based , low dose gonadotropin protocol ( 225 IU ) would non-inferior term mature oocyte yield ( eggs ready fertilize ) compare high-dose protocol . Patients meet criterion poor ovarian response consent randomized either stimulation protocol involve pretreatment 0.1mg estradiol patch luteal phase start 10 day LH surge ( hormone release brain cause ovulation occur , detectable urine ) follow oral clomiphene citrate 100mg day 2-6 menstrual cycle 225 international unit gonadotropin start day 5 , control group involve pretreatment 0.1mg luteal estradiol patch start 10 day LH surge , high dose gonadotropin ( 600IU ) alone , start day 2 cycle . After randomization , patient undergo routine IVF procedure , monitoring , blood draw , cancellation criterion , oocyte retrieval , embryo transfer non-study participant .
DOC.criteria: Patients age 1842 undergo IVF AFC < 7 ( see definition ) AMH ( see definition ) < 0.5 and/or prior poor IVF response BMI ( body mass index ) > 30 PGD ( preimplantation genetic diagnosis , embryos biopsied rule chromosomal abnormality ) Age > 42 Fragile X carrier ( condition associate premature ovarian age ) TESE ( Testicular sperm extraction ) Asherman 's syndrome ( uterine scar affect implantation pregnancy ) Untreated hydrosalpinx ( accumulate fluid fallopian tube may toxic embryo ) > 6 prior attempted cycle
